name: Safety & Survival
definition: Protecting life and dignity by ensuring health, stability, and freedom from harm. Organizations grounded in this principle safeguard people’s well-being before all else.

positiveValues.name: Safety
positiveValues.definition: Freedom from harm and risk, where people feel secure physically, emotionally, and digitally.

positiveValues.name: Stability
positiveValues.definition: Reliable structures and routines that reduce chaos and provide predictability.

positiveValues.name: Wellbeing
positiveValues.definition: Holistic care for health, balance, and resilience that supports sustained performance.

positiveValues.name: Preparedness
positiveValues.definition: Readiness through prevention, training, and proactive risk management.

positiveValues.name: Reliability
positiveValues.definition: Dependable actions and systems that can be counted on during pressure.

limitingValues.name: Fear
limitingValues.definition: A climate of threat that narrows choices and prevents openness or learning.

limitingValues.name: Scarcity Mindset
limitingValues.definition: Believing there is never enough, leading to hoarding, rivalry, and distrust.

limitingValues.name: Anxiety
limitingValues.definition: Persistent unease that drains energy and undermines judgment.

limitingValues.name: Neglect of Safety
limitingValues.definition: Failure to protect people and systems, exposing them to avoidable harm.

limitingValues.name: Rigidity
limitingValues.definition: Clinging to routines that block adaptation and create fragility under change.

name: Belonging & Loyalty
definition: Creating bonds of trust, loyalty, and care where every person feels they belong. Grounded in solidarity, it builds resilient and respectful communities at work.

positiveValues.name: Trust
positiveValues.definition: Confidence in the reliability and fairness of others, enabling cooperation and speed.

positiveValues.name: Respect
positiveValues.definition: Treating every person with dignity regardless of status, identity, or perspective.

positiveValues.name: Belonging
positiveValues.definition: A felt sense of acceptance and mattering within a team or community.

positiveValues.name: Inclusion
positiveValues.definition: Ensuring all voices are welcomed and valued, so differences strengthen outcomes.

positiveValues.name: Empathy
positiveValues.definition: Understanding others’ experiences and emotions to improve care and decisions.

limitingValues.name: Distrust
limitingValues.definition: Assuming bad intent, which slows collaboration and increases conflict.

limitingValues.name: Exclusion
limitingValues.definition: Leaving people out of opportunities or relationships, weakening community bonds.

limitingValues.name: Blame
limitingValues.definition: Pointing fingers instead of solving problems together.

limitingValues.name: Gossip
limitingValues.definition: Undermining trust by spreading unverified or harmful talk.

limitingValues.name: Favoritism
limitingValues.definition: Granting opportunities based on personal ties instead of merit or fairness.

name: Growth & Achievement
definition: Pursuing performance and growth with humility and responsibility, elevating both self and collective results without arrogance or excess.

positiveValues.name: Achievement
positiveValues.definition: Accomplishing meaningful goals that advance both people and organization.

positiveValues.name: Discipline
positiveValues.definition: Focused effort and consistency that transform ambition into results.

positiveValues.name: Accountability
positiveValues.definition: Owning actions and outcomes, and learning from mistakes transparently.

positiveValues.name: Initiative
positiveValues.definition: Acting with responsibility to start improvements without waiting for direction.

positiveValues.name: Excellence
positiveValues.definition: Commitment to raising quality and standards in pursuit of continuous betterment.

limitingValues.name: Ego
limitingValues.definition: Centering decisions on self-image rather than collective purpose.

limitingValues.name: Arrogance
limitingValues.definition: Inflated self-importance that dismisses feedback and undervalues others.

limitingValues.name: Dominance
limitingValues.definition: Using power to suppress instead of enable, undermining initiative.

limitingValues.name: Win-at-All-Costs
limitingValues.definition: Pursuing success without regard to ethics, people, or sustainability.

limitingValues.name: Burnout Culture
limitingValues.definition: Normalizing overwork and exhaustion, harming health and long-term performance.

name: Meaning & Contribution
definition: Connecting work and learning to a deeper sense of purpose and contribution, ensuring effort creates meaning beyond profit alone.

positiveValues.name: Learning
positiveValues.definition: Turning experiences into growth and wisdom that enriches people and work.

positiveValues.name: Curiosity
positiveValues.definition: Seeking new understanding to open opportunities and challenge assumptions.

positiveValues.name: Innovation
positiveValues.definition: Translating creativity into solutions that benefit people and systems.

positiveValues.name: Adaptability
positiveValues.definition: Adjusting approaches in response to change while holding onto purpose.

positiveValues.name: Contribution
positiveValues.definition: Creating impact that serves beyond self-interest.

limitingValues.name: Complacency
limitingValues.definition: Settling for mediocrity instead of striving for meaningful progress.

limitingValues.name: Dogmatism
limitingValues.definition: Rigidly clinging to beliefs or practices despite evidence for change.

limitingValues.name: Short-Termism
limitingValues.definition: Choosing immediate gains that undermine long-term value and trust.

limitingValues.name: Resistance to Change
limitingValues.definition: Rejecting adaptation even when it is necessary for survival or growth.

limitingValues.name: Fixed Mindset
limitingValues.definition: Believing ability cannot grow, discouraging learning and risk-taking.

name: Integrity & Justice
definition: Aligning words and actions with fairness and accountability. Integrity ensures that authority and decisions are exercised transparently and equitably.

positiveValues.name: Integrity
positiveValues.definition: Acting with consistency and honesty regardless of circumstances.

positiveValues.name: Honesty
positiveValues.definition: Truthful and complete communication that builds trust.

positiveValues.name: Equity
positiveValues.definition: Designing fair access to opportunity and resources for all.

positiveValues.name: Transparency
positiveValues.definition: Making decisions and processes open to scrutiny and understanding.

positiveValues.name: Accountability
positiveValues.definition: Taking responsibility for choices and correcting harm.

limitingValues.name: Corruption
limitingValues.definition: Using position or resources for unjust personal gain.

limitingValues.name: Hypocrisy
limitingValues.definition: Saying one thing and doing another, eroding credibility.

limitingValues.name: Cynicism
limitingValues.definition: Assuming nothing matters, weakening responsibility and trust.

limitingValues.name: Double Standards
limitingValues.definition: Applying rules unfairly across people or situations.

limitingValues.name: Conflicts of Interest
limitingValues.definition: Letting personal interest override fairness and duty.

name: Wisdom & Compassion
definition: Leading and serving with empathy, humility, and wisdom, ensuring that knowledge is used to uplift and not to oppress.

positiveValues.name: Compassion
positiveValues.definition: Responding to others with empathy and care in ways that build dignity and strength.

positiveValues.name: Service
positiveValues.definition: Using personal strengths to uplift others and the community.

positiveValues.name: Mentorship
positiveValues.definition: Guiding others’ growth with patience and encouragement.

positiveValues.name: Humility
positiveValues.definition: Recognizing one’s limits and learning from every person and experience.

positiveValues.name: Generosity
positiveValues.definition: Sharing time, knowledge, and resources without expecting return.

limitingValues.name: Selfishness
limitingValues.definition: Acting only for personal benefit at others’ expense.

limitingValues.name: Tokenism
limitingValues.definition: Superficial inclusion without genuine power-sharing.

limitingValues.name: Paternalism
limitingValues.definition: Helping in ways that disempower rather than enable.

limitingValues.name: Withholding Credit
limitingValues.definition: Failing to recognize others’ contributions, undermining trust.

limitingValues.name: Gatekeeping
limitingValues.definition: Blocking access to opportunities or knowledge for self-interest.

name: Transcendence & Unity
definition: Seeing life, work, and the planet as interconnected, guiding choices toward peace, sustainability, and unity across generations.

positiveValues.name: Unity
positiveValues.definition: Seeking common purpose that bridges differences and builds collective strength.

positiveValues.name: Stewardship
positiveValues.definition: Caring responsibly for resources, people, and ecosystems.

positiveValues.name: Sustainability
positiveValues.definition: Ensuring choices protect long-term human and ecological balance.

positiveValues.name: Peacebuilding
positiveValues.definition: Transforming conflict into dialogue and cooperation.

positiveValues.name: Interconnectedness
positiveValues.definition: Recognizing that all actions ripple through people, systems, and the planet.

limitingValues.name: Indifference
limitingValues.definition: Ignoring wider consequences of actions, allowing harm to persist.

limitingValues.name: Neglect
limitingValues.definition: Failing to care for responsibilities across generations.

limitingValues.name: Exploitation
limitingValues.definition: Extracting value from people or nature without fairness or care.

limitingValues.name: Short-Sightedness
limitingValues.definition: Choosing quick wins at the expense of long-term well-being.

limitingValues.name: Nihilism
limitingValues.definition: Believing nothing matters, abandoning responsibility and hope.
